channel.title: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
channel.copyright: This content is for entertainment purposes only. This content cannot be used for commercial use without written permission from the TIP network.
channel.itunes:summary: We like to have fun and study billionaires. We interview entrepreneurs and highly influential authors of business books.

image.title: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast

channel.itunes:author: Preston Pysh and Stig Brodersen | Investing Podcast, Business Podcast, Money Podcast, Entrepreneur Podcast, Stock Trading, Stock Market
channel.description: First, we like to have fun. Second, we read and talk about the books that have influenced billionaires the most.
channel.itunes:subtitle: We Study Billionaires - Investing Podcast

item.title: TIP 105 : Mastermind Group 2016 3rd Quarter (Business Podcast)
item.description:
In this episode the Mastermind Group discusses various topics during the 3rd quarter 2016. Below are some of the ideas the group talks about.

  • How can the investor find a decent yield when so many asset classes are overvalued?
  • Why special situations might provide the best investing approach right now
  • If Humana is a profitable risk arbitrage investment right now
  • How you can generate a steady cash flow by selling put options in great businesses
  • If dollar cost averaging is a good investment strategy in the current market conditions
  • If QE causes a roaring stock market
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Toby Carlisle, Risk Arbitrage, Humana, Options, Dollar Cost Averaging, Quantitative Easing, Fed Decisions, Janet Yellen

item.title: TIP 104 : Billionaire Carl Icahn - A Rare Look Behind the Scenes w/ Mark Stevens, author of King Icahn (Business Podcast)
item.description:
One of the most misunderstood celebrity investors in the world is Billionaire Carl Icahn. Luckily for our audience, our guest Mark Stevens was one of the few people to forge a relationship with the unique and un-empathetic investor.

In this episode you'll learn about:

-What “greenmail” is and how Icahn basically got paid for not taking over companies
-How to conduct an activist approach to investing
-Why Carl Icahn always wins in a negotiation
-If Carl Icahn is truly a bear in the current market conditions
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Carl Icahn, Mark Stevens, King Icahn, Warren Buffett, Corporate Raiders, Hostile Take-Overs

item.title: TIP 103 : Life Inc. - Running your home finances like a business w/ Doug McCormick
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk to private equity expert, Doug McCormick, about using business principals to invest your family income. Doug provides some unique ways to think about spending one's time and treating it like an asset.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Doug McCormick, Real Estate, Interest Rates, Ray Dalio, Dave McCormick, 30 year Bond Bubble

item.title: TIP 102 : Common Stocks & Uncommon Profits - A Discussion of Philip Fisher's Classic Book (Business Podcast)
item.description: Billionaire Warren Buffett said his investing approach is 85% Graham and 15% Fisher. Because of this quote, Preston and Stig read Philip Fisher's famous book, Common Stocks and Uncommon Profits. The book provides an interesting background on qualitative investing. Fisher's style is geared towards teaching the reader how to look for growth companies that promise expansion in their respective markets.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Warren Buffett, Phil Fisher, Benjamin Graham, Value Investing, Finance, Money

item.title: TIP 101 : Creativity Inc - by Pixar's Ed Catmull (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig read the book, Creativity Inc., by Ed Catmull. This was a fantastic book for anyone wanting to learn how to be more creative. Additionally, the book goes into great detail describing the important aspects of designing a business that will have an enduring competitive advantage.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Steve Jobs, Pixar, Ed Catmull, 3D Animation Movies, Toy Story, Walt Disney, Star Wars, George Lucas

item.title: TIP 100 : Cold-Calling Our Audience and what we Learned Studying Billionaires for 100 Shows (Investment Podcast)
item.description: In Preston and Stig's 100th episode of The Investor's Podcast, they celebrate by cold calling a few members of their audience. The members of the community can ask any question they want in an unscripted and open format. Additionally, Preston and Stig talk about what their key take-aways were after studying billionaires and the market for 100 shows.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Warren Buffett, Jack Ma, Dale Carnegie, Jim Rickards, Napoleon Hill, Andrew Carnegie, Benjamin Graham, Doug McCormick, Meb Faber, Intrinsic Value, Discounted Cash Flow

item.title: TIP 099 : Billionaire Jack Ma and Alibaba (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig learn about the Chinese billionaire Jack Ma. Jack is the founder of the internet company, Alibaba, which is the biggest internet company in Asia. His company has over 407 million users and quickly growing. Within the next five years, Alibaba may ship more packages per day than all the daily mail in the United States. Preston and Stig learn about Jack by reading Duncan Clark's new book, Alibaba.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Jack Ma, Duncan Clark, Jeff Bezos, Ebay, Amazon, e-commerce, Alibaba, Tow Bow, Alipay

item.title: TIP 098 : The Power of Habit by Charles Duhigg (Business Podcast)
item.description:
View the Show Notes for this episode

Read reviews of, The Power of Habit, on Amazon

In this episode, Preston and Stig talk about the New York Times best selling book, The Power of Habit, by Charles Duhigg. The book is an amazing opportunity to learn about your personal habits and how powerful they are at controlling your daily life. Once an individual recognizes which habits they want to reform, Charlies provides methods for re-programming your life.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Charles Duhigg, The Power of Habit, Andrew Carnegie, Think and Grow Rich

item.title: TIP 097 : China and the History of the Dollar (Business Podcast)
item.description:
In this episode, Mr. Richard Duncan provides a detailed lesson about the history of the US dollar and the American trade deficit. As the episode progresses, the listener will learn how the US defaulted on the Bretton Woods agreement in 1971 and how that drastically impacted the difficult situations we face today. Click here to view the Show Notes

Links to Richard's books:

The New Depression – Read reviews of this book

The Dollar Crisis – Read reviews of this book
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Macro Investing, Bretton Woods Conference, IMF, International Monetary Fund, US Trade Deficit

item.title: TIP 096 : Billionaire Phil Knight & Nike - Shoe Dog (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk about Billionaire Phil Knight and how he founded Nike. They use the book, Shoe Dog, to gather a first-hand account of Phil's journey at starting the business. You will learn about the struggles and difficulties of starting a brand and a new business.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Phillip Knight, Nike, Tiger Shoes, University of Oregon, Bill Bowman

item.title: TIP 095 : Billionaire Tony Hsieh's Book - Delivering Happiness at Zappos (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk about the most recent book they read, Delivering Happiness. This book was written by billionaire Tony Hsieh and it was one of the best books that Preston and Stig read in 2016.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Business Culture, Business Strategy, Tony Hsieh, Zappos, Jeff Bezos, Amazon, Customer Service

item.title: TIP 094 : Raoul Pal - Macro Economics and Global Risks (Investment Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk to one of the most notable macro investors in the world, Raoul Pal. Raoul is the owner and CEO of Real Vision TV and he has interviewed some of the biggest names in finance. During this interview, Raoul talks about some of the biggest ideas he has heard from billionaire hedge fund managers and high net worth individuals.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Raoul Pal, Real Vision TV, Stan Druckenmiller, George Soros, Jim Rogers, Ray Dalio, China Investing, Warren Buffett

item.title: TIP 093 : BREXIT - The Financial Impact (Investment Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig have a mastermind discussion about BREXIT with two close friends that live in the UK and Germany. The discussion centers around the potential of other countries leaving the EU and central banking. The group discusses the potential risks of more exits from the EU along with thoughts of other famous billionaires on the issue.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - George Soros, Howard Marks, Warren Buffett, Stanley Druckenmiller, Central Banks, UK Referendum, ECB, The European Union

item.title: TIP 092 : Billionaire Lives w/ Navy SEAL for 30 Days - feat. Atlanta Hawks Owner, Jesse Itzler
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig interview the billionaire owner of the Atlanta Hawks, Jesse Itzler. Jesse discusses his experience of living with one of the most extreme athletes in the entire world for 30 days. Additionally, Jesse talks about being successful in business and his sale of Marquis Jet to Warren Buffett.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Jesse Itzler, Atlanta Hawks Owner, Sara Blakely, Warren Buffett, Marquis Jet, Living with a Seal

item.title: TIP 091 : Mastermind Group 2Q 2016 (Business Podcast)
item.description:
In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Preston and Stig join the members of their mastermind group to discuss a few hot topics. The topics discussed are the following:

The Value of Apple

The Value of Amazon

Mohnish Pabrai's new ETF

How to look at share buy backs
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Jeff Bezos, Warren Buffett, Charlie Munger, Space X, Amazon, Apple stock Investing, Monish Pabrai ETF, Tobias Carlisle ETF

item.title: TIP 090 : Jesse Felder's Macro & Micro Views on the Market (Stock Investing)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk to billion dollar hedge fund manager, Jesse Felder. Jesse talks about the investing approach of a couple billionaires and he identifies some of the biggest risks to the current global economy.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Stanley Druckenmiller, George Soros, Ray Dalio, Warren Buffett, Charlie Munger, Jesse Felder

item.title: TIP 089 : Oil - A Bearish Opinion (Investment Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig interview oil expert, Gail Tverberg about the current market conditions with oil and other commodities. If you're wanting to understand why the oil market might be heading lower, Gail provides some interesting arguments why low interest rates and government manipulation is causing major issues.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Gail Tverberg, T Boone Pickens, Carl Icahn

item.title: TIP 088 : The Intelligent Investor (Investment Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk about Warren Buffett's favorite book, The Intelligent Investor.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Benjamin Graham, Warren Buffett, Intrinsic Value

item.title: TIP 087 : Attending the Berkshire Hathaway Shareholder's Meeting (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig play the 5 best questions that were discussed during the Berkshire Hathaway Shareholder's Meeting.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Warren Buffett, Charlie Munger, Berkshire Hathaway, Jeff Bezos, IBM, Ginni Rometty

item.title: TIP 086 : Part II - Jack Schwager & Stock Market Wizards (Investment Podcast)
item.description:
In this episode, you'll learn:

  • Why you should always decide what your exit criteria is for a security before you get in
  • How to use fundamentals in trading
  • How to optimally measure the performance of your portfolio
  • Why traders in particular might want to use daily data to evaluate their strategy
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Ray Dalio, Investing versus Trading, Jack Schwager

item.title: TIP 085 : Jack Schwager & Stock Market Wizards (Money Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig interview legendary investment author, Jack Schwager. Jack has written books about the best investors on the planet, and in this interview with us, he shares some of the most interesting people he has met. Jack talks about the most impressive investors and the scariest approaches he has written about. (remember, all the approaches resulted in fantastic results for the people implementing it)
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Edward Thorp, Jimmy Balodimas, Investing versus Trading, Jack Schwager

item.title: TIP 084 : Billionaire Ted Turner's Story (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig read a book by Ted Turner titled "Call Me Ted". The book discusses the life and business adventures of the author. It provide a glimpse into the decisions and thought process of growing a billion dollar empire.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Ted Turner, CNN, Atlanta Braves, Brown University, AOL Time Warner

item.title: TIP 083 : The First Billion is the Hardest by T Boone Pickens (Money Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig discuss T Boone Pickens' book, "The First Billion is the hardest". Pickens is a oil Tycoon from Texas and his book outlines his life of business decisions and capital management. At the end of the show, The Investors answer three questions from the members of their audience.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast | T Boone Pickens, Oil, Commodities, Carl Icahn, Share Buy Backs

item.title: TIP 082 : Jim Rickards - The New Case for Gold (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Preston & Stig have their second part interview with renown economist, Jim Rickards. In this episode, Jim talks about his book, The New Case for Gold. Jim shares his conversation with Ben Bernanke, what types of environments gold performs well, and when people need to be on the look-out for a down-turn in the economy.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Jim Rickards, Ben Bernanke, Gold, Money Podcast, Business Podcast, Investment, Currencies, Commodities

item.title: TIP 081: Jim Rickards - China, Banking, & The New Case for Gold (Part 1 of 2)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig interview world renown economist Jim Rickards about his new book, The New Case for Gold. In the interview, Jim talks about people that have influenced his way of thinking, how global currencies work, the Chinese Yuan, the Japanese economy and many other topics.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast - Jim Rickards, Kyle Bass, Warren Buffett, Ray Dalio, Stanley Druckenmiller, Jim Rogers, China, Central Banking, The New Case for Gold

item.title: TIP 080 : The Speed of Trust by Stephen Covey (Leadership Podcast)
item.description: Although everyone knows trust is important to the success of any organization, Stephen Covey takes the idea to a much deeper level. In Covey's book, The Speed of Trust, you'll learn how trust is an economic issue that revolves around the speed at which people and organizations operate.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Stephen Covey, Steve Forbes, Warren Buffett, Leadership

item.title: TIP 079 : The Effective Executive - by Peter Drucker (Business Podcast)
item.description: One of the key leadership books that billionaire Jeff Bezos recommends for all his employees is Peter Drucker's, The Effective Executive. In this episode Preston and Stig talk about the leadership lessons they learned from reading this book.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Peter Drucker, Jeff Bezos, Business, Executive Leadership

item.title: TIP 078 : Billionaire Moves in the Market & Negative Interest Rates (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, the investors talk to author of the "Modern Monetary System" - investing expect Cullen Roche. Cullen talks about some of the different investments that billionaires are making in the current market conditions. Additionally, he has a discussion about negative interest rates and how the banking system fundamentally works.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Jamie Dimon, Warren Buffett, Cullen Roche, Negative Interest Rates, Federal Reserve, Ray Dalio

item.title: TIP 077 : Billionaire Oprah Winfrey - What I Know for Sure (Investment Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Preston and Stig read a book from Billionaire Oprah Winfrey. Although this episode isn't the typical accounting and financial talk, the information discussed might be some of the most important information a person needs to be successful in life.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Oprah Winfrey, Near Death Experiences, Intentions, The Seat of the Soul, Gary Zukav

item.title: TIP 076 : Mastermind Discussion 1Q 2016 (Investment Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, The Investor's Podcast mastermind group discusses a wide array of topics from oil, currencies, Japan, Warren Buffett's Shareholder Letters, and much more.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Japan, Currencies, Warren Buffett, Berkshire Hathaway Shareholder Letters 2015, Oil

item.title: TIP 075 : The Davos World Economic Forum and The One Thing by Gary Keller (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig discuss the topics covered at the Davos World Economic Forum. Additionally, the investors discuss the book, The One Thing by Gary Keller.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Davos, The Bank of China, Ray Dalio, Gary Keller, Interest Rates

item.title: TIP 074 : Billionaire George Soros - The Alchemy of Finance (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig review George Soro's book, The Alchemy of Finance. Additionally, The Investors discuss three questions from the audience at the end of the show.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - George Soros, Warren Buffett, Benjamin Graham, Macro Investing, GoPro, Reflexivity

item.title: TIP 073 : Billionaire Howard Marks - The Most Important Thing (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig review billionaire Howard Marks' book, The Most Important Thing.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Howard Marks, Warren Buffett, Value Investing, Stock Market Investing, Seth Klarman, Joel Greenblatt

item.title: TIP 072 : Creating a $10 Million Dollar Company by Age 24 - w/ Nathan Latka (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig interview multimillionaire Nathan Latka about creating your own assets. Nathan created a $10 million dollar company by the age of 24.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Nathan Latka, Warren Buffett, Creating Passive Income, Red McCombs

item.title: TIP 071 : Value Investing Questions from the Audience and Benjamin Franklin by Walter Isaacson
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig take value investing questions from the audience. You won't want to miss their discussion on intrinsic value and many other numerous topics. Additionally, the investors review Walter Isaacson's book, Benjamin Franklin.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast - Warren Buffett, Ray Dalio, Stanley Drunkenmiller, George Soros, Stock Market, Bond Investing, Intrinsic Value, Robert Shiller

item.title: TIP 070 : Global Value Investing and Clone Investing w/ Meb Faber (Money Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig interview global value investor, Meb Faber. Meb discussess the methods for investing internationally and also on how to conduct a clone investing approach to other famous investor's stock picks.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - International Value Investing, Invest with the House, Global Asset Allocation, Global Value, Shareholder Yield, The Ivy Portfolio

item.title: TIP 069 : How to Win Friends and Influence People (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk about one of Warren Buffett's Favorite Books, How to Win Friends and Influence People by Dale Carnegie.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Dale Carnegie, Warren Buffett, Carlie Munger

item.title: TIP 068 : Current Market Conditions and Michael Lewis' Boomerang
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk about billionaire George Soros' prediction that the current market conditions resemble that of 2008. Additionally, the Investors talk about Michael Lewis' book Boomerang. http://www.theinvestorspodcast.com/episodes/68-current-market-conditions-michael-lewis-liars-boomerang.html
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - George Soros, Stanley Drunkenmiller, Ray Dalio, Michael Lewis, Warren Buffett, Value Investing, Stock Market Crash 2016, Currencies, Commodities

item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig discuss the New York Times best selling book, Liar's Poker by Michael Lewis.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Michael Lewis, Solomon Brothers, Investing, Stock Market

item.title: TIP 066 : Mastermind Discussion 4Q 2015 (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, the mastermind group discusses new and trending topics. Those topics include: investing in technology during the 4Q 2015, momentum investing combined with value investing, taking short positions in junk bonds, the Japanese currencies.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast : Oil Investing, Junk Bond Investing, Carl Icahn, Warren Buffett, Value Investing

item.title: TIP 065 : Yale Professor, Robert Shiller's Book, Irrational Exuberance (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig discuss the key points from the book, Irrational Exuberance by Robert Shiller.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Robert Shiller, Alan Greenspan, Irrational Exuberance, Warren Buffett, George Soros, The Alchemy of Finance

item.title: TIP 064 : Warren Buffett's Biography (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig discuss the key aspects of the book, Buffett: The Making of an American Capitalist by Roger Lowenstein.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Warren Buffett, Rose Blumkin, Charlie Munger, Nebraska Furniture Mart, Bill Ackman

item.title: TIP 063 : Quant Investing with Patrick O'Shaughnessy (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, The Investors talk to quant investing expert Patrick O'Shaughnessy. Patrick talks about his experiences in statistical backtesting and modeling of the stock market.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Patrick O'Shaughnessy, Value Investing, Momentum Investing, Warren Buffett, Charlie Munger, Mark Cuban, Toby Carlisle

item.title: TIP 062 : Warren Buffett's Favorite Book, Security Analysis (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig discuss their notes on Warren Buffett's Favorite Book, Security Analysis. This book was written in the 1930's and it's an enormous text. Many people in finance refer to the book as the bible of Value Investing.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Benjamin Graham, Warren Buffett, David Dodd, Security Analysis, Value Investing

item.title: TIP 061 : Billionaire Charlie Munger with Tren Griffin (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, the Investors talk to Tren Griffin about his new book on Charlie Munger. Munger is Warren Buffett's Vice Chairman at Berkshire Hathaway and one of the most influencial people in shaping Buffett's investment approach.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Charlie Munger, Warren Buffett, Tren Griffin, Berkshire Hathaway

item.title: TIP 060 : Pragmatic Capitalism with Cullen Roche (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, The Investors talk to money manager Cullen Roche about the modern monetary system. Cullen was one of the few financial thinkers that predicted the deflationary forces that would occur from the FED's quantitative easing, so we talk to him about his model and how he arrived at his conclusion.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Cullen Roche, Quantitative Easing, Financial Markets, Investing, Money Manager, The Modern Monetary System

item.title: TIP 059 : The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk about the best selling book, The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People by Stephen Covey.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Stephen Covey, Warren Buffett, Money Podcast

item.title: TIP 058 : Coined - The Essence of Money and How It Works with Kabir Sehgal (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig interview Kabir Sehgal about his New York Times best selling book, Coined. The book provides a rich story of money and how its history has shaped us.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast - Kabir Sehgal, Richard Branson, Paul Volcker, Bitcoin

item.title: TIP 057 : What Works On Wall Street with James O'Shaughnessy (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, the Investors talk to legendary investor, James O'Shaughnessy about his book, What Works on Wall Street.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - A Chat with Investing Expert and Best Selling Author James O'Shaughnessy

item.title: TIP 056 : Oil, Commodities, & Japan (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, The Investors discuss the ever changing commodities market and potential impact that China might have on Japan's economy.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Quantitative Easing, The Yen, Central Banks, Inflation, Deflation, Ray Dalio, Tres Knippa

item.title: TIP 055 : Creating Assets and a Following (Marketing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, media expert, Dori Clark, talks about how people can create online assets and develop a following around their content.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Dori Clark, Online Business, Entrepreneurship

item.title: TIP 054 : Mastermind Discussion 3Q 2015 (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, the mastermind group discusses new information about Mohnish Pabrai's Dhandho Holding Company, the Japanese Stock Market, Currency Concerns, Quantitative Easing, Warren Buffett's recent stock market purchases, and much more.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast – Mohnish Pabrai, Dhandho Holding Company, Ray Dalio, Japan Stock Market, Quantitative Easing, Warren Buffett, Value Investing

item.title: TIP 053 : Thinking, Fast and Slow | Quantitative Easing (Business Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Preston and Stig start the show by talking about the current market conditions. They focus their discussion on the quantitative easing that's happening in Europe and Japan. After the initial discussion about the stock market, the Investor's discuss the newest book they read, Thinking Fast and Slow.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast - Daniel Kahneman, Warren Buffett, Mohnish Pabrai, Ray Dalio, Carl Icahn, ETFs

item.title: TIP 052 : Billionaire Elon Musk - Tesla and SpaceX (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, Preston and Stig discuss Ashlee Vance's book about Elon Musk. If you want to learn more about one of Sillicon Valley's most unique investor/inventor, you won't want to miss this episode.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Elon Musk, Tesla, Space X

item.title: TIP 051 : Billionaire Mark Cuban's Book - How to Win at the Sport of Business (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, we talk about billioniare Mark Cuban's book and how he acquired his wealth.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Mark Cuban, Business Tips, Entrepreneurship, Investing

item.title: In-B-Tween : Billionaire Ray Dalio's Super Cycle Prediction (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this brief episode, we read billionaire Ray Dalio's white paper on the end of a super cycle.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast : A discussion of Ray Dalio's 25 AUG 2015 White Paper on the Super Cycle

item.title: TIP 050 : Current Market Conditions and Billionaire Chris Sacca's Favorite Book (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Preston and Stig talk about the crazy volatility in the financial market at the end of August 2015. Additionally, The Investors read billionaire Chris Sacca's favorite book, The Magic of Thinking Big.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Carl Icahn, Warren Buffett, Ray Dalio, Junk Bonds, High Yield Bonds, Quantitative Easing, Chris Sacca

item.title: TIP 049 : Quantitative Value Investing (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, we continue our discussion with Dr. Wesley Gray. This time around, Dr. Gray talks about Quantitative Value Investing and how individuals can take advantage of mean reversion.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Carl Icahn, Warren Buffett, Value Investing, Wesley Gray

item.title: TIP 048 : Investing in ETFs with Dr. Wesley Gray (Investing Podcast)
item.description: This episode is an advanced look at how Exchange Traded Funds, or ETFs, work. We talk with fund manager, Dr. Wesley Gray, about some of the unknown secrets in the finance industry. In addition to the ETF discussion, Stig and Preston talk to Wes about the current market conditions.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Warren Buffett, Carl Icahn, Bill Gross, Wesley Gray

item.title: TIP 047 : The Black Swan (Investing Podcast)
item.description: Billionaire Jeff Bezos and many other tech mogals have heavily endorsed the book, The Black Swan. As a result, we read the book and recorded our discussion of the key points.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Warren Buffett, Mark Cuban, Nassim Nicholas Taleb, Statistics

item.title: TIP 046 : The Innovator's Dilemma (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we talk about billionaire Jeff Bezos, Mark Cuban, and Michael Bloomberg's favorite book, The Innovator's Dilemma.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast : Clayton Christensen, Warren Buffett, Jeff Bezos, Mark Cuban

item.title: In-B-Tween : Inflation Vs Deflation (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this weeks short episode, we discuss the global tug-of-war that has been taking place since 2008.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast - Warren Buffett, Ben Bernanke, Ray Dalio

item.title: TIP 045 : Leadership You Can Invest In (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we interview leadership expert, Mike Figliuolo. Mike talks about the ways that leaders can optimize the performance of their subordinates. Additionally, he discusses the key variables of what to look for when investing in a business.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast : Leadership, Mike Figliuolo, Warren Buffett, Ray Dalio

item.title: In-B-Tween : Billionaire Carl Icahn and Junk Bonds (Investing Podcasts)
item.description: In this week's In-B-Tweener, we talk about Billionaire Carl Icahn and his opinion that the Junk Bond Market is extremely overvalued.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Carl Icahn, Warren Buffett, Ray Dalio, Junk Bonds, High Yield Bonds, Larry Fink

item.title: TIP 044 : Oil 101 - w/ Morgan Downey (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we talk to the Best Selling author, Morgan Downey, of the book Oil 101. You won't want to miss his episode if you have an interest in the recent downturn in the oil market.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast : Morgan Downey, Warren Buffett, T. Boone Pickens, Prince Alwaleed bin Talal

item.title: In-B-Tween : Intrinsic Value and Bond Market Pressures (Investing Podcast)
item.description: This In-B-Tween episode covers Warren Buffett's intrinsic value and current conditions in the bond market.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast - Warren Buffett, Bonds, Market Capitalization, Intrinsic Value, Value Investing

item.title: TIP 043 : Mastermind Discussion 2Q 2015 (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, the panel discusses the impact of oil, current market conditions, and top performing Billionaires and their investing approach.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast : Oil, Warren Buffett, Charlie Munger, Ray Dalio, Stock Market Crashes

item.title: In-B-Tween : Brands and Competitive Advantages (Investing Podcast)
item.description: This In-B-Tween-isode covers the importance of competitive advantages. The specific competitive advantage we discuss is the power of a brand.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Warren Buffett, Jeff Bezos, Richard Branson, Entrepreneur

item.title: TIP 042 : Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Shareholder Letters (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we discuss the key highlights of Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway shareholder letters. Preston and Stig discuss look-through earnings, intrinsic value, and the overall business structure.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast : Warren Buffett, Charlie Munger, Look Through Earnings, Intrinsic Value

item.title: In-B-Tween : Warren Buffett and Bill Gates on Heroes (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode, we research Warren Buffett and Bill Gates' opinions about heroes.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast : How to Select Heroes

item.title: TIP 041 : The 7 Biggest Mistakes Investors Make (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we interview West Point economics instructor, Brian Retherford, about the 7 biggest mistakes new investors make in the stock market.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast : Elon Musk, Warren Buffett, Charlie Munger, Benjamin Graham, Share Buy Backs, Business

item.title: In-B-Tween : Marketing 101 (Investing Podcast)
item.description: What are the key ingrediants to marketing. In this short In-B-Tween isode, Preston covers the importance of focus on the customer and creating a win-win environment for long-term sales.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - We Study Billionaires

item.title: TIP 040 : Richard Branson - Screw it, Let's Do It (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we talk about what we learned from reading Billionaire Richard Branson's book, Screw it, Let's Do it.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast - Richard Branson

item.title: In-B-Tween : The 3 C's of Leadership (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this 5 minute episode, Preston lay's out the 3 C's of leadership that he learned at the 101st Airborne Division.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast : Leadership

item.title: TIP 039 : The Great Minds of Investing Part II (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In the second part interview with William Green, we discuss the investing approach of Mohnish Pabrai and Joel Greenblatt. The discussion centers around the fundamentals and differences that the great minds of investing share.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast : Mohnish Pabrai, Warren Buffett, Charlie Munger, Ray Dalio, Joel Greenblatt, Bill Miller

item.title: In-B-Tween : The Top 3 Traits of Billionaires (Investing Podcast)
item.description: A 5 minute conversation about the top 3 traits of billionaires. People mentioned during this episode are Warren Buffett, Bill Gates, Charlie Munger, Richard Branson, and Albert Einstein.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast - Warren Buffett, Bill Gates, Charlie Munger, Richard Branson, Albert Einstein

item.title: TIP 038 : The Great Minds of Investing - Part I (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, William Green talks to us about his new book, The Great Minds of Investing. In this Interview we discuss Warren Buffett, Benjamin Graham, Charlie Munger, and many other investment gurus.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast – Warren Buffett, Benjamin Graham, Charlie Munger, John Templeton, Mohnish Pabrai, Bill Miller, Guy Spier, Joel Greenblat

item.title: TIP 037 : Billionaire Ray Dalio and other Market Wizards (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we discuss the book Hedge Fund Wizards by Jack Schwagger. In the episode, we focus on the ideas of Ray Dalio, Edward Thorp, and Joel Greenblatt in order to discuss the approaches we liked the best.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast - Ray Dalio, Jack Schwager, Edward Thorp, Warren Buffett, Joel Greenblatt

item.title: TIP 036 : Starting His Own Stock Exchange - with Jos Schmitt (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we have an engaging discussion with Jos Schmitt about his adventures in starting his own stock exchange. The purpose of his new exchange was to combat the impact of High Frequency Trading on the Canadian Market. If you ever wanted to hear about the inside story of starting your own stock exchange, you won't want to miss this interview.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast : High Frequency Trading, Flash Boys, Jos Schmitt, Aequitas NEO, Brad Katsuyama

item.title: TIP 035 : How Currencies Work (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we discuss current events by Warren Buffett, Bill Gates, and Janet Yellen. Additionally, we discuss the ideas contained in economist Jim Rickard's book, Currency Wars. The discussion is helpful for people trying to understand how currencies interact with public debt, gold, and global commodities.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast - Warren Buffett, Bill Gates, Charlie Munger, Janet Yellen, Jim Rickards, Currency Wars

item.title: TIP 034 : Real Estate Investing with BiggerPockets' Joshua Dorkin (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Joshua Dorkin talks about his experience in the Real Estate market and how to conduct wise investment choices. Josh runs the very popular Bigger Pockets Real Estate community. The group discusses risks in long term interest rates and fun ideas like house flipping. You won't want to miss this interesting conversation on how real estate investing is done the right way.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast : Joshua Dorkin, Warren Buffett Forum, BiggerPockets, Real Estate

item.title: TIP 033 : Shorting the Japanese Debt and Currency (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast we talk to professional trader and hedge fund manager, Tres Knippa. Tres talks about his unique positions in shorting the Japanese debt and currency markets. Tres believes the Japanese currency is destined for failure based on the government's inability to sell newly issued bonds to anyone other than themselves. The interview is very interesting and it's sure to give you some interesting ideas for the next stock market crash.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast : Tres Knippa, Warren Buffett, Mark Cuban, Janet Yellen, Alan Greenspan, Larry Summers

item.title: TIP 032 : The Balance Sheet Recession and Quantitative Easing Trap (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Preston and Stig discuss the newest book they read titled: The Escape from Balance Sheet Recession and Quantitative Easing Trap. The book was written by the economist Richard Koo and he talks about the comparison between Japan in the 1990's and the World Ecomony today.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast : Warren Buffett, Richard Koo, Ray Dalio, Larry Summers

item.title: TIP 031 : My Interview with Warren Buffett and other Billionaires - with Gillian Zoe Segal (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this interview, author Gillian Zoe Segal, talks about her interviews with Warren Buffett and many other Billionaires. In Gillian's new book, Getting There, she interviews 30 people that have become enormous sucesses. Stig and Preston ask Gillian how she got the interviews and the best pieces of advice she was provided by her subjects.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast : Warren Buffett, Michael Bloomberg, Kathy Ireland, Frank Gehry, Anderson Cooper, Marina Abramovic, Sara Blakely, Jim Koch

item.title: TIP 030 : What in the World is Bitcoin? (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode the Investors talk about the disruptive new digital currency technology that's growing around the world. Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies could eventual become a popular form of payment without limits across international boarders. This is a fascinating discussion that you won't want to miss.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast - Bitcoin, Cryptocurrencies, Digital Currency, Warren Buffett, Bill Gates, Charlie Munger, Peter Thiel, Reed Hoffman

item.title: TIP 029 : What is the Federal Reserve doing? (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we explore the history and impact of the Federal Reserve. As you will see, the Federal Reserve has the biggest impact on the growth and contraction of any other variable. We discuss that variable, the money multiplier, in this episode.
item.itunes:subtitle: Investors Podcast - Warren Buffett, Charlie Munger, Ben Bernanke, Janet Yellen, Ray Dalio, Paul Volcker, Alan Greenspan

item.title: TIP 028 : Think and Grow Rich - Napoleon Hill (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this week's episode of The Investor's Podcast, we learn about one of the most foundational books ever written on success: Think and Grow Rich, by Napoleon Hill. This book has an interesting premise - the things you think about most will materialize into your life if you have faith and reason.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investor's Podcast : The Investors Podcast - Napoleon Hill, Andrew Carnegie, Henry Ford, Bill Gates, Warren Buffett, Robert Schiller, Richard Koo, Nassim Taleb

item.title: TIP 027 : Value Investing Traps (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Andrew Sather talks about the dangers of value traps when conducting value investing. This is an important episode for many of the investors that try to impliment Benjamin Graham or Warren Buffett style investing.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast - Andrew Sather, Benjamin Graham, James O'Shaughnessy, Warren Buffett

item.title: TIP 026 : Billionaire Mark Cuban's Book Recommendation - Rework (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we discuss the key points from the book, Rework. The billionaire Mark Cuban said that if given a choice between a person with an MBA or a person who read the book, Rework, he would pick Rework every time. At the end of the show, The Investors discuss the comments by billionaire Ray Dalio and famous Harvard professor, Larry Summers.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast - Mark Cuban, Rework, Jason Fried, David Heinemeier Hansson, Ray Dalio, Larry Summers

item.title: TIP 025 : Deep Value Investing - w/ Tobias Carlisle (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investors Podcast, we interview the author of the book, Deep Value. This book is a fascinating read that statistically demonstrates the theory that companies with very bad past performance (with respect to earnings), tend to outperform high premium picks. The book was highly influenced by Benjamin Graham and Joel Greenblatt and it comes highly recommended by Preston and Stig.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Value Investing, Benjamin Graham, Joel Greenblatt, Tobias Carlisle, Ray Dalio, Acquirers Multiple

item.title: TIP 024 : How to Be an Outlier - Malcolm Gladwell's book (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we review Malcolm Gladwell's famous book, Outliers. We discuss the key ingrediants for what it takes to become an outlier and what people should be thinking about if they really want to become an enormous success like Bill Gates or the Beatles.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors podcast | Bill Gates, Charlie Munger, Malcolm Gladwell, Intelligence, Entrepreneur

item.title: TIP 023 : Stock Market Bubbles and Asset Allocation (Investing Podcast)
item.description: At the beginning of 2015, the Stock Market is at an all time high. As a result, The Investor's ask MorningStar's expert, Paul Arnold, about the proper asset allocation during these periods of high valuations. If you have a lot of money in the stock market, you might want to listen closely to this weeks episode.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | MorningStar, Warren Buffett, Ray Dalio, Stock Market Crash, Interest Rates, Banks

item.title: TIP 022 : Influence - The Psychology of Persuasion - Robert Cialdini's Book (Investing Podcast)
item.description: The Billionaire Charlie Munger has said that the book, Influence by Robert Cialdini is his favorite book of all time. In this episode we talk about the top level ideas found in Cialdini's book and relate some of the concepts back to stock investing.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Charlie Munger, Psychology, Investing, Warren Buffett, Guy Spier

item.title: TIP 021 : How to Invest in Real Estate (Investing Podcast)
item.description: Have you every wanted to buy commercial real estate, but you didn't know how to get into the game? In this episode, we harness the decades of experience from our mystery guest and learn how he built a real estate portfolio with over 100 units. You'll learn how real estate is valued and the general principals to good management.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Real Estate, Investing, Warren Buffett, Cap Rate

item.title: TIP 020 : How to Create Passive Income - with Pat Flynn (Investing Podcast)
item.description: Pat Flynn is an internet superstar that has created a multimillion dollar enterprise around online business. In this episode, Pat shares some of his secrets for creating new assets.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Pat Flynn, Smart Passive Income, Investing

item.title: TIP 019 : How High Frequency Trading Works - Michael Lewis Book (Investing Podcast)
item.description: Finance can be a very dry subject, but this episode is surely going to debunk that opinion. High Frequency Trading is a fascinating story of how a few elite technologists have outsmarted big Wall Street banks in making Billions of dollars through 1 cent increments. The problem is the common investor is the one paying the bill. You won't want to miss this exciting and ever changing story.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Stock Investing, HFT, Billionaires

item.title: TIP 018 : Tony Robbins' Book - Money, Master the Game (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Preston and Stig talk about what they learned in Tony Robbins' book, Money: Master the Game. During their discussion, they talk about the myths of investing and they also talk about the advice of a few billionaires. This was a fun and interesting episode that you won't want to miss.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Stock Investing, Ray Dalio, Tony Robbins, Money

item.title: TIP 017 : My Business Deal with Billionaire Mark Cuban (Investing Podcast)
item.description: Have you ever wondered what it would be like to go on the hit TV show, Shark Tank? In our interview with Stephan Aarstol, we ask him insider questions and also what it's like to be a business owner with billionaire Mark Cuban. The episode generated some good discussion about search engine optimization (SEO) and running an online business.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Entrepreneur, Stock Investing, Mark Cuban, SEO, Warren Buffett, Billionaires

item.title: TIP 016 : ETFs or Mutual Funds? We ask MorningStar Expert (Investing Podcast)
item.description: Are you getting ripped-off by owning a mutual fund? We think so, but let's here what MorningStar expert, Alex Bryan has to say. Learn what other options you have for protecting your principal and growing your money.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Stock Investing, Warren Buffett, Billionaires, Mutual Funds, Tony Robbins, ETFs

item.title: TIP 015 : Guy Spier (Part II) - The Education of a Value Investor (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this second part interview with Guy Spier, The Investor's continue their discussion with the author of, The Education of a Value Investor. This episode discusses intrinsic value, Guy's checklist, and how to protect your capital during adverse conditions.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Stock Investing, Warren Buffett, Billionaires, Value Investing

item.title: TIP 014 : Guy Spier - The Education of a Value Investor (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we have the renown Guy Spier on the show to talk about his new book, The Education of a Value Investor. in 2008, Guy and Mohnish Pabrai bid $650,000 to have lunch with Warren Buffett. In our interview, you'll quickly learn there's a lot more to guy than investing and expensive lunches.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Stock Investing, Warren Buffett, Billionaires, Value investing

item.title: TIP 013 : How Billionaire's Larry Page and Sergey Brin Built Google (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we have a discussion about Google and the book, In The Plex. If you ever wanted to know more about the Google founders, Larry Page and Serga Brin, or how Google makes money, you'll definitely enjoy this episode.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Stock Investing, Billionaires, Google, Tech Companies

item.title: TIP 012 : Psychology and Stock Investing (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we have a discussion with the author of, The Emotionally Intelligent Investor, about psychology and Stock Investing. If you're interested in learning about your conscious and unconscious decisions, this episode will definitely peek your interest.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Stock Investing, Warren Buffett, Charlie Munger, George Soros

item.title: TIP 011 : Billionaire Jeff Bezos - The Secrets to his Success (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Stig, Preston, and Hari, discuss Jeff Bezos's success with Amazon. The catalyst for the discussion is Brad Stone's Book, The Everything Store. Click here to download our executive summary of this book. Members who sign-up on our mailing list will recieve these free book outlines/summaries in the future.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Stock Investing, Entrepreneur, Billionaires, Business

item.title: TIP 010 : Venture Capital Q&A (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Stig and Preston have a question and answer period with Peter Gaudet - an owner of his own Investment Bank. The panel discusses venture capital and how to be successful as the founder of a company.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Stock Investing, VC, Venture Capital

item.title: TIP 009 : How Charles Koch amassed $43 Billion Dollars (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Stig and Preston discover Charles Koch's secrets to financial success. They base their opinions on Charles' book, The Science of Success. This episode is packed with valuable information, so you'll definitely want to check-out their show notes.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Charles Koch, Stock Investing, Value investing, Money, Billionaire

item.title: TIP 008 : Value Investing - Questions from a Newbie (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, the panel is asked important questions from a new value investor that's interested in putting money into the stock market. If you're looking to do the same, or you're interested in hearing some fantastic questions, you won't want to miss this week's episode.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Stock Investing, Warren Buffett, Value Investing

item.title: TIP 007 : Peter Thiel's book - Zero to One (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, the panel discusses the ideas of Peter Thiel. Peter is a famous Silicon Valley Billionaire who founded PayPal and Palantir. He also owned a 10% stake in Facebook. The Investors, along with Hari Ramachandra, discuss Peter's new book - Zero to One.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Stock Investing, Peter Thiel, Warren Buffett, Billionaires

item.title: TIP 006 : The Next Stock Market Crash & Interest Rates (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, the panel discusses the impact of interest rates on Stock Market Crashes. The Investors are joined by Rob Mercuri, who's a Vice President of Risk management from a top-ten consumer bank in America. You won't want to miss this episode if you want to know how top executives view the market as a whole and how to take advantage of potential opportunities.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Stock Investing, Interest Rates, Stock Market Crash, Warren Buffett

item.title: TIP 005 : Working on the Floor of the NY Stock Exchange (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we have a fun and casual conversation with Gregg Pisani - a former trader on the floor of the NY Stock Exchange. Gregg discusses the typical work day and what it's like processing millions of trades each day. If you've ever wondered what all those people are doing on the floor of the NY Stock Exchange, you'll probably enjoy listening to some of Gregg's funny experiences.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Stock Investing, NY Stock Exchange, Day Trading

item.title: TIP 004 : Mohnish Pabrai and Dhandho Holdings (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Hari Ramachandra discusses his investment in the Pabrai Funds, managed by the emerging, and newly famous, Mohnish Pabrai. Pabrai has adopted the same principals as Warren Buffett, and Hari discusses the similarities and differences during the episode. Hari also discusses his experience of attending Pabrai's shareholders meeting.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Value Investing, Stock Market, Pabrai Funds, Mohnish Pabrai

item.title: TIP 003 : Warren Buffett's 4 Rules to Stock Investing (Investing Podcast)
item.description: Have you ever wondered what rules Warren Buffett might use to analyze potential stock picks. In episode three, the Investors discuss Buffett's 4 rules to selecting a successful stock pick. You won't want to miss this important discussion!
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Warren Buffett, Value Investing, Stock Investing, Rules to Investing

item.title: TIP 002 : Warren Buffett Investing Basics part 2 (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this session of The Investor's Podcast, we discuss the two methods of receiving earnings and Benjamin Graham's Mr. Market example.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Warren Buffett, Benjamin Graham, Value Investing, Stock Market Basics

item.title: TIP 001 : Warren Buffett Investing Basics (Investing Podcast)
item.description: In this session of The Investor's Podcast, we discuss the fundamental elements of Warren Buffett's investing approach in the stock market.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Investors Podcast | Warren Buffett, Stock investing Basics, Value Investing
